DataElement.preferredName: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group And Karnofsky Performance Status Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number or value that determines the value, significance, or extent of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and to carry out daily activities based on the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) and the Karnofsky Performance Statuses.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

Concepts.definition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

Property.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group And Karnofsky Performance Status Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability for the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) and the Karnofsky Performance Status.

Concepts.definition: Dead.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.

Concepts.definition: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.
Moribund; fatal processes progressing rapidly.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 100=Normal, no complaints, no evidence of disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 100=Normal, no complaints, no evidence of disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Normal; no complaints; no evidence of disease.

Concepts.definition: Normal; no complaints; no evidence of disease.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 1=Symptomatic; fully ambulatory; restricted in physically strenuous activity

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 1=Symptomatic; fully ambulatory; restricted in physically strenuous activity
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light house work, office work.

Concepts.definition: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light house work, office work.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 20=Very sick, hospitalization indicated. Death not imminent

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 20=Very sick, hospitalization indicated. Death not imminent
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Very sick; hospitalization necessary; active support treatment is necessary.

Concepts.definition: Very sick; hospitalization necessary; active support treatment is necessary.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 30=Severely disabled, hospitalization indicated. Death not imminent

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 30=Severely disabled, hospitalization indicated. Death not imminent
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Severely disabled; hospitalization is indicated, although death not imminent.

Concepts.definition: Severely disabled; hospitalization is indicated, although death not imminent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Disabled; requires special care and assistance.

Concepts.definition: Disabled; requires special care and assistance.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Completely disabled. Cannot carry on any selfcare. Totally confined to bed or chair.

Concepts.definition: Completely disabled. Cannot carry on any selfcare. Totally confined to bed or chair.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 50=Requires considerable assistance and frequent medical care

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 50=Requires considerable assistance and frequent medical care
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Requires considerable assistance and frequent medical care.

Concepts.definition: Requires considerable assistance and frequent medical care.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 60=Requires occasional assistance, but is able to care for most of his/her needs

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 60=Requires occasional assistance, but is able to care for most of his/her needs
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Requires occasional assistance, but is able to care for most personal needs.

Concepts.definition: Requires occasional assistance, but is able to care for most personal needs.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 70=Cares for self, unable to carry on normal activity or to do active work

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 70=Cares for self, unable to carry on normal activity or to do active work
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cares for self; unable to carry on normal activity or do active work.

Concepts.definition: Cares for self; unable to carry on normal activity or do active work.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 80=Normal activity with effort; some signs or symptoms of disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 80=Normal activity with effort; some signs or symptoms of disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Normal activity with effort; some sign or symptoms of disease.

Concepts.definition: Normal activity with effort; some sign or symptoms of disease.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 90=Able to carry on normal activity; minor signs or symptoms of disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 90=Able to carry on normal activity; minor signs or symptoms of disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Able to carry on normal activity; minor signs or symptoms of disease.

Concepts.definition: Able to carry on normal activity; minor signs or symptoms of disease.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 2=Symptomatic; ambulatory; capable of self-care; greater than 50% waking hours out of bed

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 2=Symptomatic; ambulatory; capable of self-care; greater than 50% waking hours out of bed
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Ambulatory and capable of all self care but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours.

Concepts.definition: Ambulatory and capable of all self care but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 3=Symptomatic; limited self-care; greater than 50% waking hours in bed

ValueMeaning.preferredName: 3=Symptomatic; limited self-care; greater than 50% waking hours in bed
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.

Concepts.definition: Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group And Karnofsky Performance Status Score
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) was established in 1955. This is a cooperative group (Philadelphia, PA) funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs with almost 6000 physicians, nurses, pharmacists, statisticians, and clinical research associates from the US, Canada, and South Africa. ECOG has more than 90 active clinical trials in all types of adult malignancies. Annual accrual is 6,000 patients, with more than 20,000 patients in follow-up.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Karnofsky Performance Status. A standard way of measuring the ability of cancer patients to perform ordinary tasks.  The scores range from 0 to 100, with a higher score indicating a better ability to carry out daily activities.  KPS may be used to determine a patient's prognosis, to measure changes in functioning, or to decide if a patient could be included in a clinical trial.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A cooperative group funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs with almost 6000 physicians, nurses, pharmacists, statisticians, and clinical research associates from the US, Canada, and South Africa. ECOG has more than 90 active clinical trials in all types of adult malignancies. Annual accrual is 6,000 patients, with more than 20,000 patients in follow-up.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
An index designed for classifying patients 16 years of age or older by their functional impairment.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
